Faith of a Noob

Training never ends.

100 Days of Code Challenge - Day Five

John Hansuld
January 30, 2022

Categories

  • 100 days of code

Tags

  • Journal
  • Day 5

Today I got a good 4 hours in. Mostly researching. I learned how to install ruby and Jekyll on my laptop. Then I went through the process of setting up my blog with Jekyll. I still do not know all of it but I am learning. Jekyll allows for the use of markdown to be used in place of HTML for my posts but I have opted out of that and will continue using HTML. I personally see markdown as more useful for someone that wants just a quick blog or is not very technical. This blog is suppose to be a learning tool for me to improve my HTML, CSS, and Javascript skills.

I have a long way to go on the site, tomorrow I will focus on setting up the CSS side of things. I will also set up navigation to be better in the site by adding a category link and allowing sorting by date or by tag. I may make a todo list on the homepage to help keep me accountable.

Current list:

  • CSS
    • blog cards on homepage
    • set up blog pages
    • set up homepage
    • decide on logo, and create a permanent one(possible with SVG
    • decide and implement color scheme
    • homepage image or solid color
  • blog post
    • Linux install and setup
    • Github Pages
    • Jekyll install
    • Jekyll guide
  • fill in About page
  • add post page that can be sorted
  • add a contact page
  • add date to post with author name incase of guest post
